intro: Chamaeiris sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis’s rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the harsh conditions of its environment. Its leaves are often small and leathery, and the flowers can be pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
